definition: after all/to investigate/to study carefully/Taiwan pr. [jiu4]

sentences.english: Why should pedants be allowed to spoil the game?
sentences.chinese: 为什么要让学究们破坏了我们的游戏？

sentences.english: The habit of mind or manner characteristic of a pedant.
sentences.chinese: 迂腐的言行心理或行为带有学究气的习性。

sentences.english: Historians are for the most part very scholarly men nowadays .
sentences.chinese: 现今的历史学者大多是些学究气十足的人。

sentences.english: These were mostly detached and scholarly documents.
sentences.chinese: 这大都是一些孤立的，学究式的文件。

sentences.english: His essays can be Oxbridge musty.
sentences.chinese: 他的随笔或许带有陈腐的学究气。

sentences.english: He had a haunted look about him.
sentences.chinese: 他外表有点学究气，相当害羞。

sentences.english: They deviated little from the scholastics in tackling the standard problems.
sentences.chinese: 他们在处理典型问题时和经院派学究相差甚微。

sentences.english: Pedants sneer at an education, which is useful.
sentences.chinese: 学究们藐视教育，但教育却是有益的。

sentences.english: The old pedant used so many archaisms that half of what he said was unintelligible.
sentences.chinese: 你是个只会夸夸其谈的学究，亲爱的伙计。

sentences.english: They are too serious, too academic and not imaginative enough.
sentences.chinese: 他们太一本正经，太学究气，想象力也不够丰富。

sentences.english: The article tastes of the schools.
He had all the illumination of wisdom and none of its pedantry .
sentences.chinese: 他具有智慧的一切光辉，却没有丝毫学究的迂腐气息。

sentences.english: She's always shown an academic turn of mind.
sentences.chinese: 她总是表现出学究式的思想方法。

definition: experienced scholar/old expert in the field
lit. to wave around one's bookbag (idiom)/fig. to show off one's erudition/a person who does so
master of martial arts, in former times often employed by a landlord to teach fighting skills and guard the house/(fig.) sb who arrogantly and condescendingly lectures others
a person who has passed the county level imperial exam (historical)/scholar/skillful writer/fine talent
high sounding and impractical/high flown nonsense
lit. pale-faced scholar (idiom); young and inexperienced person without practical experience/still wet behind the ears
